description: From Latin superesse (“to be over and above”).

entries.meaning: Of or relating to the superessive case.
The superessive case, a grammatical declension used, chiefly in Hungarian, to indicate location on top of something or on the surface of something.
examples: "TIZA 'ten' and HUSA 'twenty' have irregular superessives in forms such as "TIZA:N + "OT tizenot [tizenot] 'fifteen', HUSA:N + HAT huszonhat [husonhot] 'twenty-six'; […] .
